Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HvAMP5 (Leu-rich; natural AMPs; Spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1; HvAMP1=HvAMP2=HvAMP3=HvAMP9: inactive; HvAMP4, HvAMP6=HvAMP7=HvAMP8: AMP?)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (46.15%) toPicturin 2BNL: 27%, V=K: 18%, T: 14%. GRAVY: 0.51; mol Wt: 2389.981; mol formula: C112H202N26O29; mol ex coeff: 0. HvAMP1 is inactive with a net charge = 0.Activity: active against Gram- E.coli (MIC 172 uM), S.pullorum (MIC 126 uM),  A.hydrophila (MIC > 200 uM), Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 22 uM), and S. epidermidis (MIC 18 uM).Toxicity:  murine RBC: low hemo.lytic (15%) at 200 uM (HC50 > 200 uM).  Not toxic to HEK293 till 200 uM.Structure:  helical in SDS micelles.MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: acted on membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Peng Z, Wei C, Cai J, Zou Z, Chen J. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of an antimicrobial peptide family from the venom gland of Heteropoda venatoria.
